title: Two-year-old boy injured after gang launch knife attack outside pub that left man fighting for life
text:
A two-year-old boy was injured in a stabbing at a family christening and the 24-year-old that was holding him is fighting for his life with multiple stab wounds.

Masked thugs brandishing machetes and crowbars reportedly leapt from a car to attack the man outside the Flower Pot pub in West Bromwich, West Midlands, just before 6.40pm last night.

A 24-year-old man was attacked by a gang outside the pub, near the town centre, and stabbed several times after masked thugs jumped out of a car with machetes and crowbars.

He was treated at the scene and taken to hospital by paramedics with serious injuries, where he remains today in a critical condition.

Shockingly, a two-year-old boy was also taken to hospital with minor injuries he suffered during the attack.

Witnesses say the boy had been attending a christening with his family when he was caught up in the assault.

One said that the man was holding the boy when he was attacked and tried to shield him from the gang.

A two-year-old boy was injured after a gang stabbed a man multiple times outside the Flower Pot pub in West Bromwich, West Midlands last night

The man is fighting for his life after the attack outside of the pub, though the two-year-old suffered minor injuries

They added: 'He was holding the baby when they stabbed him. He dropped the boy after they continued to hit him outside the pub.'

West Midlands Police said in a statement: 'At this stage, it is believed that the boy was not injured with any weapons. He suffered minor cuts and abrasions, consistent with him having fallen.'

The injured two-year-old boy became caught up in the violence after attending a christening with his family, a neighbour revealed.

They said: 'There was a christening party at the pub and there were lots of kids running about all day.

'It's just pure evil to target somebody at a family christening when they would know children were around.

'It doesn't get lower than that and its fortunate he wasn't seriously hurt. Not even our children are safe these days.'

Residents said the 24-year-old victim was targeted by a masked gang who leapt from a car wielding machetes, baseball bats and crowbars.

One local, who wished to remain anonymous, said: 'I heard a commotion, so opened the door and saw loads of coppers and ambulances.

'I heard that a couple of cars pulled up and some men came out with machetes, baseball bats and crowbars.

'They gave the guy a bit of a kicking, jumped back in the cars and then shot off.

'It was a 4x4 and another car. The owner of the pub, Denver Allen, said they were wearing balaclavas and masks.

'All my neighbours are shook up. I've been living here for two years, this is the first bit of trouble I've seen.'

Another resident added: 'Normally it's really quiet. For a pub there's never been any problems.

'I came out yesterday night and they were wheeling someone into an ambulance.

The man is in a critical condition in hospital after being stabbed multiple times by the gang

'Some lad ran up to me and said a man was using a machete. It's usually quiet round here. It was a bit out of the blue. You wouldn't expect it.

'I saw the victim on the floor and people surrounding him. I thought it was a brawl at first.

'No one was kicking off or anything, which was weird. It was eerily quiet in the aftermath. When I heard someone had a machete I quickly went indoors.

'I was told someone attacked the man and ran around the back of our street.'

Another neighbour, who did not want to be named, said: 'There was a bit of function at the pub last night and it looks like it was a targeted attack.

'To hear a two-year-old has got caught up in the violence is just horrific.

'How could anyone do anything like that when there's a small child around?

'I'm not sure if the kid was related to the bloke, as there were quite a few kids at the party running around the car park earlier in the day.'

Detective Sergeant Paul Cook, from West Midlands Police CID, added: 'I understand the concerns of the community and would like to offer reassurance that we're doing all we can to establish what happened yesterday and find those responsible.

'If you saw what happened, or have any information about the incident please get in touch.'

A West Midlands Ambulance Service spokesperson added: 'We were called at 6.37pm to reports of a man who has been assaulted by a number of others; they had left scene.

'We sent an ambulance, two paramedic officers and the Midlands Air Ambulance Critical Care Car.

'On arrival they found a man who had been badly hurt with a large crowd of onlookers at the scene.

'A man in 20s was treated for serious injuries and taken on blue lights to hospital with the critical care paramedic travelling.'

Anyone with information is asked to contact police via Live Chat at www.west-midlands.police.uk - between 8am and midnight or on 101 at anytime.

Crimestoppers can be contacted anonymously on 0800 555 111 quoting log number 2125 of the 06/10/2019.
description: The two-year-boy was injured in the attack which saw a gang stab a man, 24, multiple times outside of a pub in West Bromwich in the West Midlands last night.
